messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Sure—what details can you give me so I can locate the message?  

For example, any of the following would help:  
• Message-ID (if you know it)  
• Sender’s person-ID or phone number  
• Recipient’s person-ID or phone number  
• A phrase or keywords that appear in the message content  
• Rough date/time when it was sent or received  

Just let me know whichever pieces of info you have, and I’ll search with that.
I don't have any info like that.

I’m afraid I can’t perform a search without at least one piece of identifying information. Even something very approximate—like “sent sometime last week,” “contained the word ‘invoice’,” or the sender’s phone area code—would let me start narrowing things down.

Could you think of any detail, no matter how small?  
• A rough date or time window (e.g., “early June,” “yesterday afternoon”)  
• A word or short phrase that might appear in the message body  
• Part of a phone number or contact name  
• Whether you were the sender or recipient  

If nothing comes to mind right now, you might check:  
1. Your own device’s message history for dates, names, or keywords.  
2. Any email or notification that referenced the message.  
3. Calendar entries or notes made around the same time.

Let me know whatever you can find, and I’ll use it to locate the message.
I'm just looking for the most recent message.
